description: Section header title - Some quick guidelines

defaultMessage: Any coast but not any picture. Our goal is to determine the coast material at a given location. So logically, we need to see the material of the coast in the image and we need to know where this image was taken.
We need to know the location of the coast

If the image was taken with a modern mobile or digital camera, chances are good that we can automatically extract the location from the metadata. Otherwise, there is still the possibility for you to manually determine the location by placing a marker on a map (modern browsers only) -- if you remember, of course!
For privacy concerns, we cannot accept images with faces. During validation we run the images through face detection to enforce this policy.
We need to see the coast material
Ideally, the shoreline divides the image in two, so we can see the coast material and adaptation measures, if present.
